answers.answer: As far as I know NO, but if we think that Hashimoto is an autoimmune disease and usually people that have it have vitamins deficiency, so Hashi can be responsible for low vitamins and those vitamins can contribute to peridontitis (and if you have an inherited pedisposition to gum problems, the probability is higher ....), so....a poor diet, especially one deficient in calcium, vitamin C and B vitamins, can contribute to periodontal disease.Other causes are tabaco, drugs (ones that have ingredients that decrease your body's production of saliva), diabetes, Hormonal changes...
